summary: The 'Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program Enhancement Act of 2025' directs the Secretary of Agriculture to review the Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program. The review, conducted in partnership with a covered institution (land-grant or non-land-grant college), will assess the program's effectiveness, benefits and burdens on cattle producers, treatment protocols, and funding allocation. A report with findings and recommendations for improvements, including burden reduction, is to be submitted to relevant congressional committees within a year of the contract's initiation.
